tasks: Review fundamentals of User Research & Validation
Document your learning in a journal
Practice User Research & Validation through small projects
Get feedback from peers or mentors
Analyze case studies in your focus area
Apply new skills to a real project
Create a portfolio piece showcasing your work
Share your progress with the community
Review and reflect on your growth

resources.readup: As a Strategic Lead UX Designer, you have the unique opportunity to drive user-centered design across entire product ecosystems. With your expertise in UX Fundamentals, UI Craft & Visual Design, User Research & Validation, Product Thinking & Strategy, and Collaboration & Communication, you can make a lasting impact on users' lives by crafting intuitive, engaging, and effective digital experiences that meet their evolving needs.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Applying Occam's Razor for Simplified Design Decisions
topics.summary: As a Strategic Lead, you'll face complex design decisions; mastering Occam's Razor will help you simplify and prioritize effectively.
practice_points: Analyze 3 existing product designs using Occam's Razor to identify areas for simplification. Document your findings and propose 2 simplified solutions
Create a decision-making framework incorporating Occam's Razor, including pros and cons of each option. Practice applying it to a hypothetical design project

topics.name: Conducting User Research with the Jobs-to-be-Done Framework
topics.summary: As a Strategic Lead, understanding users' motivations and needs is crucial. Mastering the Jobs-to-be-Done framework will enhance your research skills.
practice_points: Conduct 2 user interviews using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework to identify pain points and opportunities for improvement. Document key findings

topics.name: Visual Design Principles: Applying Jakob's Law
topics.summary: Jakob's Law is a fundamental principle guiding visual design; mastering it will help you create more effective and user-friendly interfaces.
practice_points: Analyze 3 existing product designs using Jakob's Law to identify areas for improvement. Propose 2 redesigns incorporating the law
